column2: NEW MEXICO DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. The road is the most slippery:
column4: when it's been raining for 30 minutes or more.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 3. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: yield the right of way at corners only.
column8: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 4. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 5. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 6. Drugs may interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely:
column4: only when combined with alcohol.
column6: even if they are prescribed by a doctor.
column8: unless they are prescribed by a doctor.

column2: 7. Drivers should change lanes:
column4: gradually and carefully.

column2: 8. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 9. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 10. Drivers have to yield to pedestrians:
column4: even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic controls.
column6: only when the pedestrian is in the crosswalk.
column8: only if the pedestrians have a green light.

column2: 11. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: keep a constant speed.
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 12. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: tailgate the driver in front of you.
column8: drive above the posted speed limit.

column2: 13. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.

column2: 14. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: replace

column2: 15. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column6: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column10: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 16. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: double

column2: 17. Your vehicles braking distance will be much longer:
column4: on wet, icy or gravel roads.

column2: 18. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.

column2: 19. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
column4: side road ahead.

column2: 20. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column6: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column8: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 21. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle

column2: 22. To enter a gap in traffic while driving on a highway:
column4: speed up and let vehicles make way.
column6: watch only the vehicles behind the gap.
column8: check behind, then watch the vehicle ahead.

column2: 23. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: reduce your following distance.
column6: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column8: always drive at the highest speed allowed.
column10: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.

column2: 24. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 25. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column4: emergency flashers.
